CatDescriptText: Frank Rodgers, hight school student, 1212 Lorraine Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that theatrical productions like 'The Green Pastures,' which 'take-off' on religions, should be presented as entertainment?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that it is all right for such productions as 'Green Pasturs' to be presented as entertainment. In my opinon, the recently televised show did not make a joke out of the Bible or religion, but instead led to a better understanding of the Bible."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Rodgers wearing dark flecked zippered jacket, and light colored un-snapped cap, standing on sidewalk with billboards for Musselman's applesauce and Old Hickory Bourbon in background
